programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 6, episode 33:

Spotlight on Mariage Frères and discovering luxury teas. All you need to know about wearing stripes and the bralette. When the world of luxury leather goods meets that of sport: Franck Joubert turns football shirts into bags. Focus on Maison Empereur, hardware emporium in Marseille.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.sub-title: Il était une fois dans l'Ouest - 2e partie
programme.desc: Once upon a time in the West - Part 2 In the second part of our journey in the West, Christian and Michelle head for Penticton, Oliver and Cawston for some mouth-watering discoveries. Presenter: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: La vigne est belle
programme.desc:
Competition and mutual assistance
The summer's here. The vines are growing steadily and the winegrowers find ingenious ways to protect the first grapes from the birds and raccoons. At Les Négondos, at Pigeon Hill or at the La Bauge, Nival and Bergeville estates, everyone's rolling up their sleeves as pressing begins.
Director: Pascal Brouard (Canada, 2022)

programme.title: Les nouveaux nomades
programme.desc: Laurent is in the Gorges de la Loire; Sophie takes us off to discover a Toulouse manga school; Yvan invites us to rediscover the restaurant Le Petit Bouillon Pharamond, a Parisian institution; we also meet young designers in a small village in the Vosges and visit the Boulogne-sur-Mer aquarium. Presented by: Laurent Guillaume, Sophie Jovillard, Yvan Hallouin, Carine Aigon, Kamini.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: Marquenterre In the small Marquenterre nature reserve surrounding the Somme Bay, we meet rhubarb and kiwi farmer Mickaël, Reinette takes us in search of shellfish and teaches us all about samphire, and we head underground with Arnaud to explore the region's unexpected biodiversity. Presenter: Guy Martin.

programme.title: La recette de Guy Martin
programme.sub-title: Saucisse de Morteau, girolles, vinaigrette tiède à l'échalote et pommes fondantes
programme.desc:
The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them.
Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Bordeaux, a day unlike any other We join Éric Perrin for a stroll through the city of Bordeaux as he meets some particularly surprising local characters. A journey that begins when the city is still asleep, but the dawn workers are already busy. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Homemade corn tortillas
For an easy-to-prepare way to serve prawn tacos and a mango salsa, Ricardo cooks his own home-made corn tortillas for a flavour that's even more authentic.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
The roadside diners of the Lower St Lawrence
In the Lower St Lawrence region, two roadside diners offer a menu where seafood takes centre stage. Who could resist a visit! We also discover peameal bacon, Charlotte's market and join tourists on the trail of good food in Montreal and Ottawa...
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Bordeaux, a day unlike any other We join Éric Perrin for a stroll through the city of Bordeaux as he meets some particularly surprising local characters. A journey that begins when the city is still asleep, but the dawn workers are already busy. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Jouy-en-Josas, to visit the Toile de Jouy museum. The Argentinean chef Juan Arbelaez invites us into his kitchen, filled with a thousand and one flavours. Schiaparelli, the perfect combination of art and fashion through collections inspired by surrealism. The restorer Isabelle Pitre offers paintings and artworks all their original beauty. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Fried chicken and waffles Bob le Chef goes for a buttermilk-based cuisine with his two recipes today: fried chicken and waffles. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Éva and Alex, Montérégie (West Bolton) The birth of Éva and Alex's baby led them to leave their shared rental in the Rosemont district of Montreal for a house in Montérégie. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Foodstuffs confiscated by Customs
Each year, more than 40,000 foodstuffs are confiscated when going through Customs in Canada. So what exactly are you allowed to bring back, or not? A beer smoothie: a good mix? We also explore the world of sampling, and construction workers' lunchboxes.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: L'ancienne et la nouvelle pinacothèque de Munich Halte dans deux « temples » allemands, dédiés à l'art, appréciés pour la richesse de leurs collections. L'ancienne pinacothèque de Munich recèle un grand nombre de tableaux de peintres français de la période classique, de Claude Lorrain à Fragonard. La nouvelle pinacothèque abrite, elle, les artistes romantiques et impressionnistes. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: The Tales of Hoffmann After "Carmen" it is one of the most frequently-performed French operas in the world. "The Tales of Hoffmann", Jacques Offenbach's ultimate work, to a libretto by Jules Barbier, was created posthumously in February 1881. Robert Carsen was responsible for staging it in 2000. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Bordeaux, a day unlike any other We join Éric Perrin for a stroll through the city of Bordeaux as he meets some particularly surprising local characters. A journey that begins when the city is still asleep, but the dawn workers are already busy. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Picton, Ontario
Louis goes to Picton, in Ontario, to meet a client who is battling with a squirrel problem.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Breakfast for the "morning people" The chef Jean-Luc Boulay, from the restaurant Saint-Amour in Québec, offers the morning presenters, Patrick Masbourian, Ève-Marie Lortie and Kim Rusk, a real treat by preparing a meal that they had almost forgotten: breakfast. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Apprendre le français grâce à l'Épicerie
programme.desc:
Learning French thanks to l'Épicerie
There's no shortage of viewers who have learnt French thanks to the programme. We share their stories! We also discover a café inspired by Scandinavia, a pupil- teacher reunion, tropical-style fried chicken and a surprise tribute to Denis Gagné for his final programme!
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Musée de l'Ermitage, Saint-Pétersbourg À Saint-Pétersbourg, en Russie, l'Ermitage abrite la plus grande collection du monde de peintures, avec plus de seize mille tableaux. Des salles spectaculaires couvrent les grands courants de la période moderne, de l'impressionnisme à l'art abstrait, avec des toiles de Monet, Renoir, Cézanne, Seurat, Van Gogh, Derain, entre autres... Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Pays Bigouden
In the Pays Bigouden, Brittany, Lenny and Lucie present all the stages involved in their seaweed production, from collection to sale. Sara explains the phases in brewing beer, from hops to tasting. To end, we meet some of the bird-lovers helping birds to nest.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: America in Montbéliard! Montbéliard and the USA are two different lands yet closely links by the Franche-Comté origins of those who helped build America. In this special feature on the US in Montbéliard, the programme brings a touch of the New World to Doubs! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Should we be wary of bacon?
Despite its high nitrite levels, bacon continues to remains widely appreciated in Canada. Beware, or not? Plus: gleaning to reduce food waste, a vegetarian form of the famous General Tao chicken, and how to make turnips and swede totally delicious.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: L'excellence des boiseries de la maison Féau
